author: Imani Moise
title: Broadcom Pledges $1.5 Billion U.S. Investment to Ease Regulatory Scrutiny
text:
In a move to ease regulatory concerns, Broadcom Ltd. said Wednesday that it is committed to making the U.S. a leader in 5G technology and plans to invest $1.5 billion in training American engineers. 
The announcement comes after the U.S. Treasury, which chairs the Committee on Foreign Investment in the U.S., sent a letter scrutinizing Singapore-based Broadcomâ€™s $117 billion hostile takeover of California-based Qualcomm Inc.
